precondition: The desktop is the active window, with no other windows covering it.
action: Right Click on an empty area of the taskbar.
expected_results: A context menu will appear with options like 'Arrange Icons By', 'Refresh', 'Paste', 'Paste Shortcut', 'New', and 'Properties'.

precondition: The right-click context menu is open on the Windows XP desktop.
The "Display Properties" window is open. The "Screen Saver" tab is visible.
expected_results: The "Display Properties" window will display the "Screen Saver" tab's content.

precondition: The "Display Properties" window is open and the "Screen Saver" tab is selected.
action: Click the down arrow of the "Screen saver" drop-down list.
expected_results: A list of screen saver options will appear.

precondition: The "Screen Saver" tab of the "Display Properties" window is open. The "Screen saver" dropdown menu is open.
action: Click the "3D FlowerBox" option in the "Screen saver" dropdown menu.
expected_results: The screen saver preview will update to display the "3D FlowerBox" screen saver.

precondition: The "Display Properties" window is open and the "Screen Saver" tab is selected. The "Power..." button is visible within the "Monitor power" section.
expected_results: The "Power Options Properties" window will open in front of the "Display Properties" window.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open with the "Power Schemes" tab selected.
action: Click the dropdown arrow next to the "Turn off monitor" setting.
expected_results: A dropdown menu will appear with a list of time interval options for the "Turn off monitor" setting.

precondition: The "Turn off monitor" dropdown menu in the Power Options Properties window is open.
action: Click the "Never" option in the "Turn off monitor" dropdown menu.
expected_results: The "Turn off monitor" dropdown menu will close, and "Never" will appear as the selected option.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Turn off monitor" setting is set to "Never".
expected_results: The "Power Options Properties" window will close. The "Display Properties" window will remain open.
